messages.title: The choice we face
messages.content: In Islington South & Finsbury and across the country, the choice at this election is between Labour and the Tories.

messages.title: A future fair for all
messages.content: Labour is fighting for a future fair for all. Our priorities are your priorities.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour would support the economy now by maintaining investment, with a plan to halve the deficit by 2014 through growth, fair taxes and cuts to lower priority spending.
Labour will secure the recovery and invest in schools, hospitals, and police – so that as the economy grows, the whole country benefits.
Labour would restore the link between pensions and earnings and introduce a new Toddler Tax Credit of £4 a week. Also, we would not raise VAT.

mentions.candidate: Emily has fought tirelessly for local people as your local champion for many years.

issues.economy: Labour would support the economy now by maintaining investment.
issues.education: Labour will secure the recovery and invest in schools, hospitals, and police – so that as the economy grows, the whole country benefits.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour would restore the link between pensions and earnings and introduce a new Toddler Tax Credit of £4 a week.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm proud to live in Islington South & Finsbury. It is where my husband and I have a home, where we work, and where our children go to school.

quotes.text: Labour is fighting for a future fair for all.

images.caption: Emily at work in the constituency.
Emily Thornberry with a local resident.
Emily and Labour's health team fighting to save the Whittington's A&E.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Strengthen and renew Labour's commitment to social justice, the environment, freedom from poverty, ignorance and ill-health.
